intro: Aizoon secundum, commonly known as the common hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically have five petals and a prominent central stigma. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Aizoon secundum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in gardens and landscapes.
